import os
import getpass
from shutil import rmtree

from .autoval import AutovalUtils
from .autoval_exceptions import TestError
from .generic_utils import GenericUtils


[docs]class SiteUtils:

    _site_settings = None
    _log_dirs = {
        "dut_logdir": None,
        "dut_tmpdir": None,
        "control_server_logdir": None,
        "control_server_tmpdir": None,
        "tmpdir": None,
        "resultsdir": None,
        "system_logdir": None
    }


[docs]    @classmethod
    def _load_site_settings(cls):
        """ Return specific site setting as dictionary located at
            ../autotest_testfiles/validation_utils/cfg or the settings json
            file location set in env variable HAVOC_SITE_SETTINGS
        """
        if cls._site_settings is not None:
            return

        site_settings_file = ""
        site_settings_env = os.environ.get(
            "HAVOC_SITE_SETTINGS",
            "site_settings.json"
        )
        _settings_file = cls._get_settings_file_path(site_settings_env)
        if _settings_file:
            site_settings_file = _settings_file
        else:
            raise TestError("Did not find Site Settings file {}".format(
                site_settings_env
            ))
        cls._site_settings = AutovalUtils.load_json(site_settings_file)



[docs]    @classmethod
    def _get_settings_file_path(cls, filename):
        """Returns file path if specified file exists. If file is not found
           also check in par utils for existence"""

        lib_path = (os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)))
        _relative_file_path = os.path.join(
            lib_path, os.pardir, 'cfg', filename
        )

        if os.path.isfile(filename):
            return filename
        elif os.path.isfile(_relative_file_path):
            return _relative_file_path
        else:
            par_lib_path = "havoc/autotest_testfiles/validation_utils"
            import libfb.py.parutil as parutil
            json_path = parutil.get_file_path(
                os.path.join(par_lib_path, "cfg", filename))
            return json_path



[docs]    @classmethod
    def create_logdirs(cls, logdir, host, testname, test_start_time):
        dir_path = SiteUtils.get_full_path_for_dir(
            cls.get_site_setting("dut_logdir"),
            host.hostname,
            testname,
            test_start_time
        )
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "dut_logdir", dir_path, host
        )
        # Create DUT tmp dir which will be deleted at
        # the end of the test
        dir_path = SiteUtils.get_full_path_for_dir(
            cls.get_site_setting("dut_tmpdir"),
            host.hostname,
            testname,
            test_start_time
        )
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "dut_tmpdir", dir_path, host
        )
        # Create tmp dir on the control server (i.e Havoc server) which will be
        # archive to resultsdir at the end of the test
        dir_path = SiteUtils.get_full_path_for_dir(
            cls.get_site_setting("control_server_logdir"),
            host.hostname,
            testname,
            test_start_time
        )
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "control_server_logdir", dir_path, host, dut=False
        )
        # Create tmp dir on the control server (Havoc server) which will be
        # deleted at the end of the test
        dir_path = SiteUtils.get_full_path_for_dir(
            cls.get_site_setting("control_server_tmpdir"),
            host.hostname,
            testname,
            test_start_time
        )
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "control_server_tmpdir", dir_path, host, dut=False
        )

        if logdir:
            dir_path = logdir
        else:
            dir_path = SiteUtils.get_full_path_for_dir(
                cls.get_site_setting("resultsdir"),
                host.hostname,
                testname,
                test_start_time
            )

        autoval_tmpdir = os.path.join(dir_path, 'autoval_tmpdir')
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "tmpdir", autoval_tmpdir, host, dut=False
        )

        system_logs = os.path.join(dir_path, 'system_logs')
        SiteUtils.create_log_directory(
            "system_logdir", system_logs, host, dut=False
        )




[docs]    @classmethod
    def create_log_directory(cls, dir_name, dir_path, host, dut=True):
        """
        dut_logdir --> Log dir at DUT and achieve at the end the test. Used to
                       store critical data on the test server during test.
        dut_tmpdir --> tmp dir at DUT and deleted at the end of the test.
                       store non critical data on the test server during test

        control_server_logdir --> Log dir at control server and achieve at the
                                  end the test. store any critical data on the
                                  control server.
        control_server_tmpdir --> tmp dir at control server and deleted at the
                                  end the of the test. store non critical data
                                  on the control server.

        tmpdir --> tmp dir at glusterfs (resultsdir) and deleted at the end
                   the test.
        """
        # Create DUT logs directory which will be archive to
        # resultsdir at the end of the test
        if dut:
            _dir = cls._dut_make_dir(dir_path, host)
        else:
            _dir = cls.make_dir(dir_path)
        cls._log_dirs[dir_name] = _dir
        return cls._log_dirs[dir_name]


    @classmethod
    def _dut_make_dir(cls, path, host):
        cmd = "mkdir -p %s" % path
        host.run(cmd)
        return path


[docs]    @classmethod
    def make_dir(cls, path, force=False):
        return GenericUtils.create_dir(path, force)


    @classmethod
    def _get_log_dirs(cls, dir_name=None):
        empty_dir = None
        if dir_name:
            if cls._log_dirs[dir_name]:
                return cls._log_dirs[dir_name]
            else:
                empty_dir = dir_name
        else:
            empty_dir = []
            for directory in cls._log_dirs:
                if not directory:
                    empty_dir.extend(cls._log_dirs)
        if not empty_dir:
            return cls._log_dirs
        raise TestError("The required log directories do not exist %s" % empty_dir)


[docs]    @classmethod
    def create_resultsdir(
        cls,
        logdir=None,
        hostname=None,
        testname=None,
        test_start_time=None
    ):
        if logdir:
            resultsdir = cls.create_log_directory(
                "resultsdir", logdir, host=None, dut=False)
        else:
            dir_path = cls.get_full_path_for_dir(
                cls.get_site_setting("resultsdir"),
                hostname,
                testname,
                test_start_time
            )
            resultsdir = cls.create_log_directory(
                "resultsdir", dir_path, host=None, dut=False
            )
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "Logging to {}".format(resultsdir)
            )
        os.chdir(resultsdir)
        return resultsdir



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_critical_services(cls):
        services = cls.get_site_setting('dut_critical_services', raise_error=False)
        if services is not None:
            return services
        return []



[docs]    @classmethod
    def cleanup_log_directories(cls, host):
        """
        dut_logdir --> Log dir at DUT and achieve at the end the test.
        dut_tmpdir --> tmp dir at DUT and deleted at the end of the test.
        control_server_logdir --> Log dir at control server and achieve
                                  at the end the test.
        control_server_tmpdir --> tmp dir at control server and deleted
                                  at the end the test.
        tmpdir --> tmp dir at glusterfs (resultsdir) and deleted
                   at the end the test.
        """
        _host = host.hostname.replace('.facebook.com', '')
        dut_logdir = cls.get_dut_logdir()
        is_dut_log_empty = cls._is_dir_empty(host, dut_logdir)
        if not is_dut_log_empty:
            cls._archive_to_resultsdir(
                host,
                dut_logdir,
                "dut_logs.tgz"
            )
            cls._delete_dir(dut_logdir + _host, host)

        control_server_logdir = cls.get_control_server_logdir()
        is_cs_log_empty = cls._is_dir_empty(
            host, control_server_logdir, local=True
        )
        if not is_cs_log_empty:
            cls._archive_to_resultsdir(
                host,
                control_server_logdir,
                "control_server_logs.tgz",
                local=True
            )
            cls._delete_dir(
                control_server_logdir + _host,
                host,
                local=True
            )
        cls._delete_dir(
            cls.get_tmpdir(),
            host,
            local=True
        )
        cls._delete_dir(
            cls.get_site_setting("control_server_tmpdir") + _host,
            host,
            local=True
        )


    @classmethod
    def _is_dir_empty(cls, host, dir_path, local=False):
        cmd = "ls %s" % dir_path
        if not local:
            out = host.run(cmd)
            if out:
                return False
            else:
                return True
        else:
            try:
                if os.listdir(dir_path):
                    return False
                else:
                    return True
            except OSError:
                return False

    @classmethod
    def _archive_to_resultsdir(cls, host, dir_to_arc, filename, local=False):
        arc_to = cls.get_resultsdir() + "/" + filename
        cmd = "tar -cvf %s %s" % (arc_to, dir_to_arc + "/")
        if local:
            host.localhost.run(cmd)
        else:
            host.run(cmd) # noqa

    @classmethod
    def _delete_dir(cls, dir_path, host, local=False):
        cmd = "rm -rf %s" % dir_path
        if local:
            rmtree(dir_path)
        else:
            host.run(cmd)


[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_full_path_for_dir(cls, path, hostname, testname, test_start_time):
        _host = hostname.replace('.facebook.com', '')
        _date = datetime.fromtimestamp(test_start_time).strftime(
            '%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S'
        )
        _full_path = os.path.join(path, _host, testname, _date)
        testdir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), _full_path)
        return testdir

[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_site_setting(cls, name, raise_error=True):
        cls._load_site_settings()
        setting = cls._site_settings.get(name, None)
        if setting is None and raise_error:
            raise TestError("Site setting %s not found" % (name))
        return setting



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_site_settings(cls):
        cls._load_site_settings()
        return cls._site_settings



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_firmware_path(cls):
        repo = cls.get_site_setting('repository_dir')
        return os.path.join(repo, "bin")



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_tool_path(cls):
        repo = cls.get_site_setting('repository_dir')
        return os.path.join(repo, "tools")



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_rotor_settings(cls):
        try:
            rotor_password = cls.get_site_setting('rotor_password')
        except TestError:
            return False

        return rotor_password



[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_ssh_key_path(cls):
        key_path = None
        try:
            key_path = cls.get_site_setting('ssh_key_path')
            key_path = [key.replace('USERNAME', getpass.getuser())
                        for key in key_path
                        if key]
        except Exception:
            pass
        return key_path
